alert.note: Alert for Bee; Coastal Aransas; Coastal Calhoun; Coastal Kleberg; Coastal Nueces; Coastal Refugio; Coastal San Patricio; Duval; Goliad; Inland Calhoun; Inland Kleberg; Inland Nueces; Inland Refugio; Inland San Patricio; Jim Wells; La Salle; Live Oak; McMullen; Victoria; Webb (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 05 at 3:14PM CDT until April 06 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...Critical Fire Danger Conditions Wednesday Afternoon and Early Evening for South Texas... .A frontal boundary will move through South Texas Wednesday morning bringing much drier air to the region. North winds of 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph will occur in the afternoon. The relative humidity values will fall to around 15 percent over the Brush Country to 20 to 30 percent over the coastal plains resulting in a Critical Fire Danger conditions for all of south Texas except the islands. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND VERY LOW HUMIDITY FOR SOUTH TEXAS... The National Weather Service in Corpus Christi has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 1 PM to 8 PM CDT Wednesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...La Salle...McMullen...Live Oak...Bee... Goliad...Victoria...Webb...Duval...Jim Wells...Inland Kleberg...Inland Nueces...Inland San Patricio...Coastal Aransas...Inland Refugio...Inland Calhoun...Coastal Kleberg... Coastal Nueces...Coastal San Patricio...Coastal Refugio... Coastal Calhoun. * TIMING...Wednesday from 10 AM until 8 PM CDT. * WIND...North at 20 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph. * HUMIDITY...Minimum values from 14 percent in the Brush Country to 20 to 30 percent for the coastal region. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Residents are urged to exercise care with respect to all outdoor activities that could inadvertently cause wildfires. Report wildfires quickly to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office.
